channel.title: Will Reed

item.title: Bio Sketch
item.description: William Reed is Chair of the Department of Government and Politics at the University of Maryland, College Park, with a Ph.D. in Political Science specializing in International Politics. He is a renowned researcher in bargaining and negotiation, publishing in top-ranked political science journals and receiving funding from prestigious organizations. With over 22 years of experience in higher education, he has held leadership positions and taught internationally. As Chair, he oversees multiple research centers and has secured significant external funding.

item.title: Selected Publications
item.description: Reed, William. "Alliance Duration and Democracy: An Extension and Cross-Validation of" Democratic States and Commitment in International Relations"." American Journal of Political Science (1997): 1072-1078. Reed, William. "A unified statistical model of conflict onset and escalation." American Journal of Political Science (2000): 84-93. Lemke, Douglas, and William Reed. "War and rivalry among great powers." American Journal of Political Science (2001): 457-469. Reed, William. "Information, power, and war." American Political Science Review 97.
